NZ.V.summary: New Zealand Energy Corp., through its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration and production of oil and natural gas in New Zealand. The company holds interests in three petroleum mining licenses, one petroleum mining permit, and one petroleum exploration permit. It has interests in TWN Petroleum Mining Licenses comprising Waihapa/Ngaere, and Tariki; Copper Moki petroleum mining permit; and Eltham Petroleum exploration permit. It also operates midstream assets. As of December 31, 2019, the company had proved and probable reserves of 707,700 barrels of oil. New Zealand Energy Corp. was founded in 2010 and is based in Wellington, New Zealand.

NZEOF.summary: New Zealand Oil & Gas Limited engages in the production, exploration, evaluation, and appraisal of oil and gas properties. It operates through Kupe Oil and Gas Field (Kupe), Oil & Gas Exploration, and Cue Energy Resources Limited segments. The company develops, produces, and sells natural gas, liquefied petroleum gas, and condensate. Its principal producing asset is the Kupe gas and light oil/condensate field located in Taranaki, New Zealand. The company also holds an interest in the Sampang PSC with 2 producing fields, including Oyong oil and gas field, and Wortel gas field covering an area of approximately 536 square-kilometers situated in the Madura Straight offshore Madura Island in East Java, Indonesia; Mahato PSC covering an area of 5,600 square kilometer located in the Central Sumatra basin; and Mahakam Hilir PSC covering an area of 344 square-kilometers situated in the Kutei Basin onshore Kalimantan, Indonesia. In addition, the company engages in the exploration and evaluation of hydrocarbons in the offshore Taranaki basin and offshore Canterbury basin, New Zealand, Australia, and Indonesia. The company was founded in 1981 and is headquartered in Wellington, New Zealand. New Zealand Oil & Gas Limited is a subsidiary of O.G. Oil & Gas Singapore Pte. Ltd.
